title: Knicks wrest Game 1 from Pistons with 21-0 run
content: The Knicks, down as much as eight in the fourth quarter, went on a 21-0 run to take control of Game 1 vs. the Pistons.

title: Russ' 'attack mode' stings Clips, lifts Denver in OT
content: With the Clippers practically daring him to beat them, Russell Westbrook came up big at the end of regulation and again in overtime for the Nuggets, who roared back from a 15-point deficit to beat the Clippers 112-110 in overtime in Game 1.

title: 'So grateful': Ohtani, wife welcome first child
content: Los Angeles Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani and his wife, Mamiko Tanaka, announced the birth of their first child on Saturday.

title: Deion eyes QBs, not ceremony, in CU spring game
content: Former Colorado players Shedeur Sanders and Travis Hunter had their jerseys retired Saturday before Colorado's spring game.

title: Berrios confronts Raleigh, suspects pitch tipping
content: Jose Berrios, Saturday's starter for the Toronto Blue Jays, suspected Seattle Mariners catcher Cal Raleigh was relaying pitch information to his teammates and wanted him to know what he thought of it, exchanging words with him after the fourth inning.

title: 'Incredible third period' rescues Jets in Game 1
content: Kyle Connor's one-timer with 1:36 remaining in the third period snapped a 3-3 tie, and the No. 1 seed Winnipeg Jets survived a Game 1 scare to post a 5-3 victory over the St. Louis Blues Saturday in the opening contest of this year's Stanley Cup playoffs.

title: OU conquers '24 demons, reclaims gymnastics title
content: Fueled by last season's stunning early exit, Oklahoma reclaimed its place atop the college gymnastics world by winning the NCAA women's title Saturday.

title: Missouri State safety dies in possible gun mishap
content: Todric McGee, a 21-year-old safety at Missouri State, died Saturday from a possible accidental gunshot wound.

title: How the Nuggets outlasted the Clips in OT, and what to know for Wolves-Lakers
content: What's standing out from each of the Western Conference first-round series, including Clippers-Nuggets and Wolves-Lakers on Saturday.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs mega-preview: Championship cases, X factors, bold predictions for all 16 teams
content: The postseason Thunderdome is about to open its gate. Which team will emerge as the 2025 Stanley Cup champion?

title: Lapsed fan's guide to the 2025 playoffs: The NHL's second season begins
content: Miss anything the past six months? Miss EVERYTHING? Here are the top teams, players, matchups and more.

title: 'How do we get better?' How Padres' October disappointment inspired 2025 success
content: The Padres were a win away from knocking out the Dodgers last year. Now, they're determined to come back even stronger -- even against the defending champs.

title: WrestleMania 41 LIVE: Results and analysis for Reigns vs. Punk vs. Rollins
content: Who will emerge victorious in the Roman Reigns vs. CM Punk vs. Seth Rollins triple threat match at Night 1 of WrestleMania 41? Follow along for live updates.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: USWNT's Rodman out indefinitely with back injury
content: USWNT star Trinity Rodman has been ruled out indefinitely by the Washington Spirit as she continues to manage an ongoing back injury, the NWSL team confirmed to ESPN.

title: Barça net 'unbelievable' win, fear for Lewandowski
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick lauded Barcelona's "unbelievable" comeback against Celta Vigo as the "best feeling" after Raphinha's stoppage time penalty sealed a vital 4-3 win for the LaLiga leaders.

title: Bundesliga history made with 8 goals in 1st half
content: Union Berlin and VfB Stuttgart made history on Saturday as the first Bundesliga game to feature eight goals before halftime.

title: Villa's Watkins: I was 'fuming' at PSG benching
content: Recalled Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins took out his anger on Newcastle United on Saturday with a dazzling display in his side's 4-1 victory in the Premier League.

title: Coach: Celta player target of racist slurs at Barça
content: Celta Vigo midfielder Ilaix Moriba was targeted by racist insults from Barcelona fans after their La Liga game on Saturday, his coach said.

title: Lyon strike late to edge Arsenal in UWCL semi
content: Kadi Diani and Melchie Dumornay handed Arsenal a rare defeat at the Emirates Stadium on Saturday as Lyon opened the Women's Champions League semifinal tie with a 2-1 win.

title: USMNT's Richards sent off in Palace draw
content: Bournemouth had to settle for a 0-0 draw against Crystal Palace in the Premier League at Selhurst Park on Saturday, with the hosts having been reduced to 10 men late in the first half after defender Chris Richards was sent off for a second yellow card.

title: Ancelotti rules out Madrid rift, won't talk future
content: Carlo Ancelotti has denied there's any rift behind the scenes at Real Madrid, saying he will discuss his future with the club at the end of the season.

title: Riddick's favorite players in the draft: Five first-round locks, five Day 2 sleepers to watch
content: Louis Riddick picks his guys in the 2025 class, including a hard-hitting safety and a ball-hawking corner.

title: The long fight ahead for boxing's Heather Hardy
content: The former boxing champ uses her brain injury to call for systemic changes to improve the health and education of fighters.

title: Former champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. is the right opponent for Jake Paul
content: Chavez's best day are in his rearview mirror, but this matchup is a big step up in competition for Paul.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Villa eyeing Palace's Eze
content: Will either Manchester United or Aston Villa sign Crystal Palace's Eberechi Eze? Transfer Talk has the latest news and gossip.

title: US Administration Urges Court To Allow Deportations Under Alternative Laws: Report
content: After the US Supreme Court temporarily barred the deportation of migrants, President Donald Trump's administration has urged the top court to allow the use of alternative laws.

title: "Bloody Sh*t Show": Omar Abdullah Slams Delhi Airport After Flight Diverted
content: The Delhi Airport, which has been witnessing massive delays for the past week, issued an advisory for passengers on Sunday morning.

title: JD Vance, Wife Usha To Visit Akshardham Temple, PM Modi To Host Dinner
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will host a dinner for US Vice President J D Vance and Indian-origin Second Lady Usha, after holding talks with the American leader that are set to focus on trade, tariff and several other key issues.

title: Mamata Banerjee Accuses RSS, BJP Of "Instigating Violence In Bengal"
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Saturday said that Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) and the BJP are responsible for instigating communal violence in the state.

title: "Completely Reject": BJP Distances Itself From MPs' Remarks On Judiciary
content: The denial from the BJP was firm and unequivocal. The ruling party at the Centre underlined that it respects the judiciary, and that the comments made by its MPs against the Supreme Court have nothing to do with the BJP.

title: Israeli Army Says Soldier Killed In Gaza, First Since Ceasefire Collapsed
content: The Israeli military announced that a soldier had been killed on Saturday in the fighting in Gaza, the first fatality since a ceasefire with Hamas collapsed in mid-March.

title: Iran Says To Hold More Nuclear Talks With US After Latest Round
content: The United States and Iran on Saturday concluded a second round of high-stakes talks on Tehran's nuclear programme, agreeing to meet again in a week's time, the Iranian foreign ministry said.

title: "We Should Shut Parliament If...": BJP MP's Big Remark On Supreme Court
content: The remarks against the Supreme Court just got a lot more edgier, angrier. First, it was Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar. Now, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey.

title: "If You Don't Pass Me...": What Teachers Found In Class 10 Answer Sheets
content: The answer sheets carried requests and currency notes: the request was that the examiner help them clear the exam. Say, the examiner found the plea too plain, some students had also slipped in money to make it lucrative for the assessor.

title: "Want Justice": Flyers Complain Of Long Delays In Jammu Due To Bad Weather
content: Jammu airport saw chaotic scenes with hundreds of passengers complaining of inconvenience after bad weather led to flight cancellations in Srinagar and affected connecting flights.

title: Manipur To Verify Papers Of Arms Licence Holders, Dealers
content: The Manipur government has asked all district administrations in the state to examine the papers of arms licence holders and arms dealers, an official said on Saturday.

title: Tripura Body Wants Kokborok Language In 8th Schedule Of Constitution Amid Row
content: Amid demands in Tripura for the adoption of Roman script for the tribal Kokborok language, an indigenous literary body has written to Chief Minister Manik Saha, seeking the inclusion of the language in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution.

title: Mumbai Civic Body Transfers Official After Row Over Jain Temple Demolition
content: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Saturday transferred an assistant municipal commissioner after the demolition of a Jain temple in Vile Parle area of the city sparked a controversy.

title: 4 Maoists Involved In C-60 Commando's Killing Arrested In Maharashtra
content: Four hardcore Maoists, including two women, involved in the killing of a C-60 commando during an encounter in February and carrying a cumulative reward of Rs 40 lakh on their heads were arrested in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district on Saturday.

title: Air Hostess Sexual Assault Case Accused Watched Porn Before Crime: Gurugram Cops
content: The accused hospital staffer arrested in flight steward sexual assault case watched porn videos before and after committing the crime, Gurugram police said here on Saturday.

title: 22-Year-Old Tricked Into Marrying Bride's Mother, 45, In UP
content: A man was allegedly tricked into marrying the mother of his 21-year-old bride here, police said Saturday.

title: 'Don't Learn History From Him': BJP MP Jabs Rahul Gandhi Over Mistake
content: BJP MP Lahar Singh Siroya has taken a swipe at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for a mistake in narrating history linked to his family and India's struggle for independence from British rule.

title: Will Aim To Completely Free Iran Of Nuclear Weapons: Oman On US-Iran Talks
content: The foreign ministry of Oman, which is mediating the nuclear negotiations between the United States and Iran, said the two sides were seeking an agreement that guarantees the Islamic republic does not possess nuclear weapons.

title: Woman Teacher Charged For Assaulting Girl, Causing Injury To Private Parts In Gujarat
content: A female teacher in Gujarat's Rajkot city was booked for allegedly assaulting a 4-year-old schoolgirl and inflicting injuries on her private parts, a senior police official said on Saturday.

title: "I Condemn Congress": Piyush Goyal Backs Probe Agency's Action In Herald Case
content: Union minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday said the action by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case is aimed at protecting the nation's assets from being "taken over by the Gandhi family for personal use".

title: Court relief from deportation for 133 international students in US
content: A US district court has temporarily protected 133 international students from deportation by reinstating their SEVIS records after sudden termination. The court's order prevents federal authorities from misusing the students' data and compels government agencies to comply. This action addresses alleged unlawful actions by immigration authorities, emphasizing the importance of adhering to legal procedures and preventing irreparable harm to students.

title: 'You are tubelights': Owaisi’s swipe after Nishikant Dubey's remark on SC
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticized BJP leaders, labeling them "tubelights" after controversial remarks by BJP MPs against the Supreme Court and Chief Justice of India. Owaisi defended the judiciary, referencing Article 142 of the Constitution. The BJP has distanced itself from the MPs' statements, with party president J.P.

title: J&K CM Omar Abdullah fumes as Delhi-bound IndiGo flight gets diverted to Jaipur
content: An IndiGo flight carrying Jammu and Kashmir's Chief Minister Omar Abdullah was diverted to Jaipur due to congestion at Delhi airport, causing significant disruption. Abdullah expressed his frustration on social media, highlighting the operational chaos and leaving passengers stranded.

title: Siddaramaiah writes to Rahul, says legal team drafting Rohith Vemula Act
content: Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has directed his legal team to draft the Rohith Vemula Act, aimed at curbing caste-based discrimination in educational institutions, following Rahul Gandhi's urging. Gandhi highlighted the systemic discrimination faced by marginalized communities, referencing the tragic deaths of students like Rohith Vemula. The Act seeks to prevent future instances of discrimination and promote equality in education.

title: Thousands protest in UK against Supreme Court ruling on definition of 'woman'
content: Thousands protested in London and Edinburgh against a UK Supreme Court ruling defining "woman" as assigned female at birth. Activists fear the decision impacts trans rights and access to single-sex spaces. The ruling stemmed from a dispute between the Scottish government and For Women Scotland over interpreting the Equality Act.

title: When LinkedIn co-founder told employees: Go home and then open laptops to …
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman believes work-life balance is incompatible with startup success, advocating for a relentless work ethic. He argues that those prioritizing balance are not fully committed to winning, emphasizing the intense demands of the startup environment. Hoffman points to the financial rewards reaped by early LinkedIn employees as justification for his demanding approach.

title: Chahal and Mahvash fuel dating speculation with airport sighting
content: Social media personality RJ Mahvash's appearances alongside cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal have intensified dating rumors, especially after his separation from Dhanashree. Mahvash has been a regular presence at Punjab Kings' IPL matches, openly supporting Chahal and sharing supportive messages and selfies. Chahal has also responded warmly, further fueling speculation amidst his strong performances for the team.

title: 'Woke up to watch an 8th grader'
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old batting prodigy, became the youngest IPL player for Rajasthan Royals, smashing a six on his first ball. His impressive 34-run innings and partnership with Yashasvi Jaiswal caught the eye of Google CEO Sundar Pichai. Despite Suryavanshi's debut and other strong performances, the Royals narrowly lost to Lucknow Super Giants by 2 runs.

title: ED’s chargesheet against Sonia, Rahul a ‘lie-sheet’: Mallikarjun Kharge
content: The Congress party is escalating its opposition to the government in the National Herald case. Top leaders, including Mallikarjun Kharge, are denouncing the ED's chargesheet as a politically motivated "lie-sheet" targeting Sonia and Rahul Gandhi. The party plans nationwide press conferences starting Monday to protest the alleged vendetta.

title: Lauren Sánchez, Jeff Bezos' fiancee receives $7,000 designer purse from Kardashians
content: Following Lauren Sánchez's Blue Origin space flight, Kris Jenner, Kim, and Khloé Kardashian gifted her a $6,995 Judith Leiber UFO handbag. The Kardashians supported Sánchez in Texas, praising the historic all-female mission. Sánchez also addressed the need for better-fitting spacesuits for women, collaborating with designers to create a suit specifically designed for women.

title: Not stalling delimitation, just seeking postponement: Stalin
content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin defends his government's opposition to delimitation based on population census, arguing it penalizes states like Tamil Nadu that successfully implemented population control measures. He also criticizes the three-language policy, viewing it as Hindi imposition, and accuses the Governor of acting against the state's interests.

title: IPL: Avesh rips victory out of Royals’ mouth with ice-cool last over
content: Lucknow Super Giants defeated Rajasthan Royals by two runs in a thrilling IPL 2025 match. Avesh Khan's superb final over sealed the victory for Lucknow. Rajasthan needed nine runs in the last over with six wickets remaining. Avesh Khan dismissed Shimron Hetmyer and kept his cool under pressure. David Miller dropped a crucial catch, adding to the drama.

title: BJP rejects MP Dubey's remark that 'CJI is to blame for civil wars in India'
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey criticized Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna for questioning the waqf law amendments, alleging judicial overreach and blaming the CJI for potential civil unrest. Dubey asserted that the court is overstepping its boundaries by interfering with laws passed by the Parliament. The BJP has distanced itself from Dubey's remarks, emphasizing they are his personal views.

title: Tesla Bull Ross Gerber: Elon Musk isn’t coming back, his next move is...
content: Ross Gerber, a Tesla investor, has intensified his criticism of Elon Musk, asserting that Musk's focus has shifted away from the electric car company, particularly towards X AI. Gerber believes Musk's involvement with controversial figures like Donald Trump has negatively impacted Tesla's reputation.

title: Rahul Gandhi reaches US on two-day visit
content: Rahul Gandhi, Leader of the Opposition, arrived in the United States for a visit to Brown University, greeted by members of the Indian Overseas Congress. He will engage with students, faculty, and the NRI community. This visit follows a previous trip in September 2024 where he spoke at universities and sparked debate regarding India's reservation system and caste representation.

title: Happy Easter Sunday 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes
content: Easter Sunday, a pivotal Christian festival symbolizing renewal and hope, will be observed on April 20th, 2025. This movable feast, determined by the lunar calendar, commemorates Jesus Christ's resurrection. Formalized in 325 AD, Easter also concludes Lent, a period of reflection. The occasion is marked by exchanging wishes and celebrating the enduring themes of faith, love, and new beginnings.

title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine will 'mirror' Russia as Putin announces Easter truce
content: Following Vladimir Putin's announcement of an Easter ceasefire, Volodymyr Zelenskyy stated Ukraine would "mirror" Russia's actions, responding to silence with silence and attacks with defensive strikes. He proposed extending the truce to 30 days to test Russia's true intentions, criticizing Moscow's manipulation and ongoing assaults. The US has warned it may withdraw from peace deal efforts without progress.

title: Thackerays spark buzz of reunion ‘for Maha’s identity’
content: Speculation about a potential reconciliation between Raj Thackeray and Uddhav Thackeray has resurfaced, with both expressing a willingness to unite for Maharashtra's benefit. Raj emphasized the need for mutual desire, while Uddhav stressed the importance of a commitment against supporting the BJP. Political figures have weighed in, with varying degrees of interest and caution regarding the possibility of a reunion.

title: US-Iran nuclear talks to resume April 26 after 'very good progress' in Rome
content: The US and Iran are gearing up for another round of nuclear talks in Oman on April 26, buoyed by "very good progress" made in Rome. US envoy Steve Witkoff and Iranian deputy foreign minister Abbas Araghchi engaged in rare face-to-face discussions. While Iran seeks a “balanced agreement,” Trump reiterated his firm stance against Iran acquiring nuclear weapons.

title: Isro to launch two high-profile space missions in May-June
content: India's space program is gaining momentum with astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla's upcoming trip to the ISS as part of the Axiom-4 mission, marking the second Indian in space. Following this, the joint Indo-US NISAR satellite, a significant Earth observation project, is scheduled for launch in June. These missions highlight India's growing capabilities and international collaborations in space exploration.

title: Taylor Swift’s steals spotlight at Country Music Hall of Fame in Nashville
content: Taylor Swift's iconic 'Fearless' tour dress and memorabilia are now on display at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum, drawing Swifties to Nashville. The exhibit, featuring her crystal-studded guitar and Louboutin heels, will run through spring 2026.

title: Israeli soldier killed in northern Gaza, first since ceasefire with Hamas collapsed
content: Warrant Officer Ghaleb Sliman Al-Nasasra was killed, and three other soldiers were severely injured during combat in northern Gaza, the IDF announced. Al-Nasasra, a tracker from the Bedouin community in Rahat, is the first Israeli fatality since the ceasefire with Hamas ended in mid-March.

title: Delhi-US flights 10-15% cheaper this summer
content: Airfares to the US have surprisingly decreased this summer, a trend attributed by some to US policies. Flights from Mumbai show the most significant drop, with one-way tickets to New York available for as low as Rs 37,000.

title: 11 dead as building collapses in northeast Delhi, CM orders probe
content: A four-story building collapsed in Delhi's Mustafabad early Saturday, resulting in 11 fatalities, including four children, and 11 injuries. Chief Minister Rekha Gupta has ordered an investigation into the 'pancake collapse,' suspected to be worsened by recent rains and storms. Rescue efforts by NDRF and fire officials saved 15 people.

title: 'Israel has no choice,' says Netanyahu as Gaza airstrikes kill 90 in 48 hours
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu affirmed Israel's commitment to its military campaign in Gaza, vowing to eliminate Hamas and secure the release of hostages despite growing domestic pressure. Recent airstrikes in Gaza have resulted in numerous Palestinian casualties, including women and children, raising concerns about humanitarian conditions amid tightened blockades and warnings of widespread hunger and malnutrition.

title: Second Bangladesh embankment near Tripura border sparks flood fears
content: Tensions escalate as Bangladesh constructs an embankment near the Muhuri River in South Tripura, raising security concerns and flood fears. CPM legislator Dipankar Sen urges Union intervention, citing Indira-Mujib pact violations. Villagers fear potential flooding of Belonia town due to restricted river flow.

title: PM Modi on 2-day trip to Saudi from Tuesday
content: PM Modi's Saudi Arabia visit prioritizes energy, trade, investment, and defense, alongside addressing global issues like the West Asia conflict and the Russia-Ukraine war. Discussions will include the India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor (IMEEC) and Saudi Arabia's proposed $100 billion investment in India. Both nations aim to strengthen defense ties and explore increased military exercises, fostering a deeper strategic partnership.

title: India likely to explore ‘early tranche’ in US trade deal
content: Indian trade negotiators are heading to Washington D.C. to explore an "early tranche" deal, potentially addressing a limited set of issues to expedite negotiations with the U.S. Both countries aim to finalize the agreement quickly, possibly before the fall deadline, while navigating regulatory hurdles like digital tax and reciprocal tariffs. Clarity is expected during U.S.

title: Prime suspect in dad-son killing held in Murshidabad
content: A key conspirator, Ziaul Sheikh, was arrested in connection with the Jafrabad double murder case, marking the fourth arrest in the incident. He is accused of instigating the mob during the violence. The Murshidabad violence has led to over 100 FIRs and 276 arrests.

title: 24 score 100 percentile in JEE (M); 7 from Rajasthan, Maharashtra next best with 4
content: The JEE Main 2025 results reveal 24 students achieved a perfect 100 NTA score, with 10 securing it in the April session. Rajasthan leads with seven top scorers, followed by Maharashtra, Telangana, and UP.

title: Tahawwur Rana disclosures may prompt NIA to re-examine Headley
content: Following Tahawwur Hussain Rana's extradition, NIA is interrogating him about the 26/11 attacks and David Headley's role. Rana's disclosures may lead to NIA seeking further access to Headley, currently jailed in the US. Headley, according to former home secretary G K Pillai, was Rana's key link to the conspiracy, updating him on LeT's plans and reconnaissance.

title: More hired than fired but IT pain lingers
content: Indian IT firms are exhibiting cautious hiring approaches amidst economic uncertainties and increased automation. While some firms saw slight headcount increases in the March quarter, overall hiring remains subdued compared to previous years. Companies are prioritizing cost efficiency and maximizing existing resources, leading to a challenging job market for college graduates, with expectations of flat hiring trends throughout 2025.

title: Hindi in Maharashtra after NEP: Why BJP is walking on a tightrope?
content: Maharashtra's BJP-led government is facing opposition over making Hindi a compulsory third language in schools under the New Education Policy 2020. Raj Thackeray's MNS party strongly opposes this move, viewing it as an imposition of Hindi on Marathi speakers. Congress has also criticized the decision, fearing it undermines Marathi culture.

title: 'I've put an end to all fights': Uddhav says open to joining hands with Raj Thackeray
content: Uddhav Thackeray, Shiv Sena (UBT) chief, signalled a potential reunion with cousin Raj Thackeray. This comes before the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation election. Thackeray expressed readiness to unite for Maharashtra's benefit. He emphasised prioritising the state's interests. The move occurs amidst challenges for the Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance. The Thackeray cousins have a complex political history.

title: 'SC breaching its boundaries': BJP sharpens attack, targets CJI Sanjiv Khanna
content: Following Vice President Dhankhar's criticism, BJP leader Nishikant Dubey has escalated the conflict with the Supreme Court, suggesting Parliament should shut down if the court makes laws. Dubey accused the Supreme Court of inciting religious wars and exceeding its authority, particularly regarding Article 377 and the Waqf Act, sparking debate over the judiciary's role.

title: IGIA runway to reopen in 2 weeks, shut again after summer for ILS upgrade
content: Delhi Airport faces significant flight delays due to the closure of runway 10/28 for upgrades and unexpected storms. Authorities plan to reopen the runway for non-precision approaches within two weeks to increase arrival capacity. Airlines are asked to reschedule flights to manage delays, with concerns about potential losses and future disruptions if upgrades aren't completed on time.

title: Murshidabad violence: CM Mamata Banerjee appeals for peace
content: West Bengal's Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has urgently appealed for peace amidst escalating violence. She accused the BJP and RSS of inciting division following protests in Murshidabad over the Waqf (Amendment) Act. Banerjee emphasized unity, condemning the riots and assuring strong action against perpetrators, including the removal of police officers.

title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi talks about what he inherited from Nehru and his legacy
content: Rahul Gandhi reflected on Jawaharlal Nehru's enduring legacy, emphasizing his role in instilling courage in Indians to resist oppression and stand for truth. He highlighted that Nehru's greatest contribution was not just political leadership but teaching Indians to confront fear. Gandhi asserted his commitment to truth, inspired by leaders like Nehru, Gandhi, Ambedkar, Patel, and Bose.

title: Viral video: 14-yo Vaibhav Suryavanshi in tears after debut IPL dismissal
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old Rajasthan Royals' debutant, captivated the IPL with a rapid 34 off 20 balls, including two impressive sixes. Despite a promising start, his innings ended with a stumping, leading to visible emotion as he departed the field. His performance, however, has marked him as a player to watch for the future.

title: Delhi building collapse: Toll mounts to 11
content: A building collapsed in Mustafabad, Delhi early Saturday. Rescue operations are underway. Several people are feared trapped under the debris. NDRF and Delhi Police teams are at the site. The collapse follows recent heavy rainfall and thunderstorms in Delhi. Last week, a wall collapse near Madhu Vihar resulted in one death and two injuries.

title: Indi-Chini boys in US mount legal challenge against MAGA strike on foreign students
content: Indian and Chinese students are fighting back against the Trump administration. They have filed a lawsuit in a US court. The students allege wrongful visa terminations. They claim minor infractions led to deportation threats. The students seek visa reinstatement. They want to stop detentions. The lawsuit highlights disruptions to their education. They are pursuing degrees in the US.

title: Watch: 14-year-old Vaibhav announces himself with first ball six!
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old Rajasthan Royals player, marked his IPL debut in spectacular fashion. Becoming the youngest player in the league, he launched his first ball, bowled by Shardul Thakur of Lucknow Super Giants, for a massive six at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium. Suryavanshi joins a select group of batters who have achieved this feat in their inaugural IPL match.

title: Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers, Mets or Padres No. 1 this week?
content: the los Angeles Dodgers have fallen from the top spot thanks to a recent rough patch . the New york Mets, San Diego Padres or San Francisco Giants replaced the defending champions atop our week 3 Power Rankings .

title: Brunson's shoe switch, Pacers roll, and what's ahead for the Cavs and Celtics
content: the 2025 playoffs are underway, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . the no. 4 Indiana Pacers easily handle the 5-seed Milwaukee Bucks, who'll wait on whether Damian Lillard will return to action for Game 2 .

title: Playoff picks: Every first-round series, plus Cup champion, Conn Smythe Trophy
content: the 2024-25 NHL season is officially in the rearview mirror . sixteen of the league's teams have made the postseason bracket . 16 have been eliminated . the player who will win the Conn Smythe Trophy (playoff MVP)

title: 2025 NCAA gymnastics championships: Oklahoma wins the title
content: the Sooners are now tied with UCLA for the third most team titles in NCAA history . OU was in the lead heading into the final rotation . Audrey Davis earned a 9.9250 for her sky-high piked Jaegar .

title: Chaos at Jammu airport as multiple flights cancelled due to bad weather
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: BJP & RSS plotting riots, says Mamata
content: ​In pics: Mamitha Baiju’s stylish wardrobe collection​ How to make the easiest cheesy chicken kebabs at home Sridevi’s most cherished pictures with daughters Janhvi Kapoor and Khushi Kapoor Know your fashion aesthetic based on your zodiac sign Janki Bodiwala’s best elegant looks ​​8 must-try fish curries for dinner​ Mohanlal's ‘Thudarum’ makers unveil BTS orchestration of soundtrack by Jakes Bejoy — 4 Reasons why the hype is getting high 10 authors whose books were rejected first, but then became bestsellers 8 ways to spot a liar, as per psychology

title: MLS, Saudi Arabia or another club in Europe: What's next for Kevin de Bruyne?
content: new signing Kevin De Bruyne is looking for a new club after news broke in early April that city would not be offering him a contract at the end of the 2024-25 season . there's heavy interest from within Major League Soccer as reports emerged last week that inter Miami acquired de Brune's MLS discovery rights . the Saudi Pro League is also reportedly interested, but it's far from a guarantee .

title: Stanley Cup playoffs first-round guide: Best bets and Conn Smythe predictions
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs begin on saturday with 16 teams looking to etch their name onto Lord Stanley's Cup . the Winnipeg Jets look to make their first Stanley Cup Final appearance . they will face the los Angeles Kings for the fourth straight postseason .

title: Richmond Town’s Leonard Lane transformed in community clean-up drive
content: What was once a garbage-strewn stretch, plagued by abandoned vehicles, has now turned into a walkable lane after 33 years

title: ‘Janivara’ row: Principal and staff dismissed in Bidar; two guards suspended at Shivamogga
content: Shivamogga DC said that lack of awareness had led to the incident, and contrary to news being circulated by some, ‘sacred thread’ had not been cut by anyone

title: Target of May-end for NHPC’s Subansiri dam triggers downstream impact worries in Assam
content: Environmentalists point out that an independent reservoir management authority, recommended in 2019 by an expert committee, is yet to be set up

title: BJP rejects its MPs criticism of Supreme Court, says it respects courts
content: “The BJP has nothing to do with the comments of MPs Nishikant Dubey and Dinesh Sharma on the judiciary and the Chief Justice”

title: Why are civil disputes being criminalised? | Explained
content: What is the perception about civil cases? Why is there a belief that a criminal case will lead to a more effective legal remedy? Does using the criminal tag for a civil dispute amount to abuse of the law? What have the courts ruled? Where does the remedy lie?

title: FM to participate in G2o, IMF-World Bank meetings during 11-day visit to U.S., Peru
content: Ms. Sitharaman will also participate in an event featuring Indian diaspora in San Francisco and interact with the Indian community settled there

title: Raj, Uddhav spark rapprochement buzz, say ready to ignore trivial issues
content: "It is not the question of my wish or selfishness. We need to look at the larger picture. All Maharashtrians should form one party," Raj said

title: B.R. Gavai | A firm hand
content: The second Dalit to be the CJI, the judge takes over at a time when the judiciary is facing criticism for overreach and allegations of corruption

title: Sadanand Date | Fight to the finish
content: For the NIA chief, the extradition of Tahawwur Rana to India was a critical moment of his investigation into the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks

title: Watch: Why are Phule and Ambedkar’s ideas still making people uncomfortable?
content: This week, as we celebrated Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar’s 135th birth anniversary, we also saw a controversy surrounding ‘Phule’, the biopic on his guru Mahatma Jyotiba Phule and Savitribai Phule

title: Congress top brass discusses follow-up steps to Ahmedabad session, strategy on ED chargesheet against Gandhis
content: Party plans ‘Save Constitution’ rallies, doorstep campaign; the BJP busy weakening SC, attacking powers given to it by Constitution, says Jairam Ramesh

title: Lotus will bloom on the top of two leaves: BJP State president Nainar Nagenthran
content: Addressing BJP functionaries after a rally, he says the DMK alliance is opportunistic, while the NDA is honest

title: Judiciary and press are the two pillars of democracy: Justice Madan B. Lokur
content: ‘The manner of assault on the independence of the press and the judiciary is different, but the assault continues,’ the former Supreme Court judge, delivering the keynote address at the Nai Duniya Foundation’s Media for Unity Awards

title: Tackling wastes head on: A Chennai point of view
content: The quest for a better economic system based on the processing, reuse, and regeneration of waste in an environment-friendly way has been a challenge in Chennai for many years. Here, Aloysius Xavier Lopez provides an overview of garbage handling in the city, with inputs from R. Aishwaryaa.

title: Mega DSC in A.P. to be held from June 6 to July 6; notification today
content: Aspirants can submit applications online and pay the fees from April 20 to May 15, says Director of School Education V. Vijay Rama Raju

title: Security deployed in M.P. village amid tensions over man, woman eloping, say police
content: The mob of approximately 200 people set shops on fire and attacked police with stones, amid protests over the departure of a local man and woman, an incident later termed ‘love jihad’ by a BJP MLA Pradeep Lariya.

title: Vijay calls TVK’s IT and social media wing best in India
content: He also urges party cadre to continue maintaining dignity and decency while using social media platforms

title: IMEC initiative on track despite conflict in West Asia, says Foreign Secretary ahead of PM’s visit to Saudi Arabia
content: IMEC work can proceed in parallel, in a distributed fashion, despite hurdles caused by Israel-Palestine conflict, says Mr. Misri; adds that India is working with “select partners” on the initiative

title: Gujarat court sentences ex-IAS officer, three others to 5-year jail terms in land allotment case
content: The court said Pradeep Sharma's sentence would commence after he undergoes the five-year term given by a sessions court in Ahmedabad earlier this year in a 2004 corruption case

title: Second medical opinion: Soon all hospitals may have to share data on elective joint surgeries with Health Department
content: Since its launch on November 19 last year, the dedicated second opinion helpline -18004258330 - has received 99 calls

title: Krishna Collector reviews arrangements at airport for Prime Minister’s visit on May 2
content: Measures should be taken to avoid any inconvenience to the passengers who booked tickets on flights on that day, says Balaji

title: Nitish misusing government funds for upcoming Bihar election, claims Tejashwi
content: Leader of Opposition claims the State government hastily approved schemes worth ₹76,622 crore in the last seven Cabinet meetings and most of which were related to construction; he alleges that the Minister of the department concerned is taking 30% commission in every tender

title: Did Rikki Rai miss the bullet the first time, but became a target hours later?
content: Police say the shooter may have been hiding behind a compound wall nearby and shot at Rikki Rai’s car

title: J&K’s progress lies in cooperation with Centre: Omar Abdullah
content: J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah assured the people of J&K that he will continue to work in collaboration with the Central government to ensure a better future for our citizens; inaugurates new Municipal Parking Complex

title: I can say whatever I want because the truth protects me, says Rahul Gandhi
content: In a conversation with party leader Sandeep Dikshit, Rahul says he inherited ‘truth and courage’ from his great-grandfather and the country’s first Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru

title: Odisha farmer looks to reap benefits of his paddy seed’s commercialisation
content: Jayant Kumar Jena holds official registration for Keonjhar Kalachampa, a local paddy variety which is tolerant to major diseases and pests and can withstand vagaries of climate change

title: 16 street vending zones to come up in Kozhikode
content: Minister  for Local Self-Governance M.B. Rajesh inaugurates distribution of identity cards to street vendors

title: Commuters along Civil Line Road have a nightmarish ride due to Kochi metro works
content: Motorists to and from the IT hub and other establishments in Kakkanad have no other option since the metro agency has not redeveloped alternative roads that run parallel to Civil Line Road

title: Chirag Paswan should contest Bihar Assembly election, says LJP (Ram Vilas) MP
content: Lok Janshakti Party MP Arun Bharti statement comes after Mr. Paswan’s own views expressed to a news channel that he wants to focus more on Bihar and does not want to spend much time in the Centre for too long

title: Climbing over walls that confine
content: A non-profit in Rajasthan’s Jaipur district allegedly ‘sold’ over 1,500 girls and women from vulnerable families into marriage for eight years, the police find. Ashna Butani explores the stories of a teenage girl and a woman who broke free and ended up exposing the trafficking racket

title: 12 Maoist dumps, including bunker-style room, uncovered in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur
content: Elite CRPF unit uncovers and destroys 12 Maoist dumps in Chhattisgarh, recovering weapons and materials, conducting continuous patrols

title: Rajasthan High Court forms panel for improving conditions at Government Advocate office
content: The HC said there was a shortage of ministerial staff, lack of infrastructure, and inadequate remuneration to the State law officers, which often resulted in the procedural delays, affecting the dispensation of justice

title: Minister Narayana calls for e-waste management
content: Several rallies and awareness drives were held across Nellore, Prakasam and Tirupati districts as part of Swachh Andhra-Swarna Andhra programme with ‘e-check’ theme

title: AIMPLB announces series of protests against Waqf amendment
content: A series of roundtable meetings with those who believe in the composite culture and constitutionalism would be held beginning May 18, AIMPLB announced

title: Government’s anti-cybercrime unit issues alert against frauds targeting pilgrims
content: The I4C has advised citizens to verify the authenticity of websites before transferring money, avoid clicking on suspicious “sponsored” or unknown links on Google, Facebook, or WhatsApp

title: Manipur government directs officials to verify papers of arms license holders, dealers
content: Local authorities have also been urged to ensure that gun license holders in their respective villages are notified of the verification process and comply accordingly

title: Rajput woman in Ajmer takes up mission to end child marriages
content: Sonu Kanwar, herself married at the age of 12, has stopped about a dozen child marriages, and prevented hundreds of future child marriages by spreading awareness and seeking police intervention

title: Thrissur’s mega job fair is just the beginning, more job drives to follow, says Minister Rajan
content: Vijnana Kerala and its district-level mission Vijnana Thrissur are key steps towards realising the State government’s vision of creating 20 lakh jobs, says Minister for Higher Education R. Bindu.

title: Former bureaucrats fault Telangana government over forest clearance in Kancha Gachibowli
content: A  statement by the group of retired bureaucrats accused the government of violating Supreme Court  directives

title: Large number of workers in Karnataka set to breach ESI income ceiling as minimum wage is set to rise
content: Currently ₹ 21,000 per month is the fixed income ceiling to be eligible for ESI, and Karnataka has written to Centre thrice seeking its upward revision to ₹ 30,000 that will cover most workers if done

title: CBI books three former top officials of Chhattisgarh for allegedly influencing probe
content: CBI registers FIR against former Chhattisgarh officials for influencing ongoing cases, conducting searches and seizing incriminating documents

title: Church takes out Way of the Cross procession to spot where cross was removed in Thommankuthu
content: Procession held in protest against the Forest department, which removed a cross erected by the church beside the Neyyassery-Thokkumban road on April 12

title: SIT grills Rajampet MP Midhun Reddy for eight hours in Andhra Pradesh liquor scandal
content: Terming the case as nothing but political harassment, the YSRCP leader says not one of the several cases filed against him has been proved

title: A new policy for e-waste management is in the pipeline, says A.P. Chief Secretary
content: Reduce, Reuse, Recycle centres will be set up across the State for collection and recycling of e-waste, says Vijayanand

title: Leptospirosis, shigellosis, hepatitis A cases rising in Kerala
content: There were 3,525 leptospirosis cases in 2024, up from 2,482 in 2022. In 2024, there were 7,966 hepatitis A cases; the figure was 231 in 2022. The State reported 119 cases of shigella in 2024 and 83 cases in 2022

title: Textbook renaming: Sivankutty writes to Union Minister
content: He says decision to assign names in Hindi is a disturbing departure from the long-held practice of naming textbooks in the language in which they are written

title: Thrikkakara municipality adopts measures to check substance abuse
content: The council has approved the formation and deployment of special municipal squads following the alarming rise in the use of banned intoxicating substances across the State, says the Chairperson

title: GVMC Mayor’s ‘ouster’ is tantamount to murdering democracy, says YSRCP president Jagan
content: The manner in which the TDP, with fewer seats than the YSRCP, wrested power in the civic body shows its penchant for power, he says

title: CPI(M) accuses Congress of lackadaisical opposition to Waqf Act in Lok Sabha
content: KPCC president K. Sudhakaran; Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi; and Congress MP from Wayanad Priyanka Gandhi Vadra were absent during the debate on the law that posed a threat to Muslim religious bequests
